case_name: Management of R.S. Madhoram Sons Agencies (P) Ltd. v. its workmen

facts.text: Civil Appeal No. 13 of 1963 was filed in the Supreme Court.

anchor.surface_text: CIVIL APPELLATE JURISDICTION Civil Appeal No. 13 of 1963.

facts.text: Appeal by special leave from the award dated January 20, 1962 of the Industrial Tribunal No. 307 of 1961.

anchor.surface_text: Appeal by special leave from the award dated January 20, 1962, of the Industrial Tribunal No. 307 of 1961.

facts.text: Judgment delivered on November 14, 1963 by GAJENDRAGADKAR J.

anchor.surface_text: November 14, 1963. The Judgment of the Court was delivered by GAJENDRAGADKAR J.-

facts.text: Industrial dispute arose between appellant Management of R.S. Madhoram Sons Agencies P Ltd. and respondents workmen regarding transfer of 57 employees.

anchor.surface_text: Between the appellant, the Management of R.S. Madhoram Sons  Agencies   P  Ltd., and the respondents, its workmen an Industrial dispute arose in regard to the transfer of 57 employees from the management of R.S. Madho- ram Sons, which was their original employer, to the appellant.

facts.text: R.S. Madhoram Sons is a firm consisting of members of a joint Hindu family, in existence since April 1, 1946.

anchor.surface_text: S. Madhoram Sons, and R.S. Madhoram Sons  Agencies  Ltd. are the two companycerns involved in this dispute. The first is a firm companysisting of the members of a joint Hindu family and the second is a companypany formed by the said members. The firm has been in existence since April 1, 1946

facts.text: R.S. Madhoram Sons Agencies Ltd. came into existence on August 29, 1961.

anchor.surface_text: whereas the companypany came into existence on August 29, 1961.

facts.text: Firm has head-office at Dehra Dun and branches at Delhi, New Delhi, Mussoorie and Amritsar.

anchor.surface_text: The head-office of the firm is at Dehra Dun and it runs branches at Delhi, New Delhi, Mussoorie and Amritsar.

facts.text: Firm acts as selling representatives of Obeetee Private Ltd., Mirzapur Commonwealth Trust Ltd., Calicut, and United Coffee Supply Co. Ltd., Coimbatore.

anchor.surface_text: The firm acts as selling representatives of Obeetee  Private  Ltd., Mirzapur Commonwealth Trust Ltd., Calicut, and United Coffee Supply Co. Ltd., Coimbatore.

facts.text: Firm also acts as Government contractors as well as stockists of the Elgin Mills Co. Ltd., Kanpur.

anchor.surface_text: It also acts as Government companytractors as well as stockists of the Elgin Mills Co. Ltd., Kanpur.

facts.text: 57 employees were originally employed by the firm, out of 92 on the muster roll.

anchor.surface_text: The 57 employees whose transfer from the firm to the companypany has given rise to the present dispute were originally employed by the firm. On the muster roll of the firm, 92 employees were entered.

facts.text: Company took over the retail business of the firm together with the staff as from September 15, 1961.

anchor.surface_text: the agreement between it and the firm, it has taken over the retail business of the firm together with the staff employed by the firm in the said retail business as from September 15, 1961.

facts.text: Agreement between firm and company on September 14, 1961 provided continuity of service, no less favorable terms, and liability for compensation on continuous service basis.

anchor.surface_text: It appears that on September 14, 1961, there was an agreement between the transferor and the transferee as a result of which the employees engaged by the transferor were transferred to the transferee companypany.

facts.text: Another agreement executed on September 15, 1961 for takeover of entire retail business.

anchor.surface_text: Another agreement was executed between the firm and the companypany on September 15, 1961, as a result of which the companypany took over the entire retail business hitherto run by the firm.

facts.text: Notice issued to workmen intimating takeover by company, counting prior service, option to leave within 3 days.

anchor.surface_text: After this transaction was thus companypleted between the firm and the companypany, numberice was issued to the workmen in question intimating to them that as a result of the transfer their services would be taken over by the transferee companypany.

facts.text: Respondent Union did not respond favourably to the notice and workmen unwilling to forego status as employees of the firm.

anchor.surface_text: For reasons which it is number easy to understand or appreciate, the respondent Union representing the appellants employees does number appear to have responded favourably to this numberice

facts.text: Dispute referred for adjudication by Delhi Administration to Industrial Tribunal, New Delhi.

anchor.surface_text: This dispute was referred for adjudication by the Delhi Administration to the Industrial Tribunal, New Delhi.

facts.text: Respondents claimed the transfer is invalid.

anchor.surface_text: The case of the respondents was that the impugned transfer is invalid, whereas the appellant companytended that the said transfer was fully valid and justified under s. 25FF of the Act.

facts.text: Appellant claimed transfer valid under s. 25FF.

anchor.surface_text: whereas the appellant companytended that the said transfer was fully valid and justified under s. 25FF of the Act.

facts.text: Tribunal held s. 25FF does not apply to the case.

anchor.surface_text: the only point which has been urged betoken us by Mr. Setalvad on behalf of the appellant is in relation to the finding of the Tribunal that s. 25FF does number apply to the present case.

facts.text: Muster roll of firm was common for all departments, same terms and conditions, employees transferable between departments.

anchor.surface_text: In the present case, the muster roll showing the list of employees was companymon in regard to all the departments of business run by the transferor firm. it is number disputed that the terms and companyditions of service were the same for all the employees

facts.text: Supreme Court held that s. 25FF does not apply as there was no transfer of ownership or management of an undertaking.

anchor.surface_text: Having regard to the facts which are relevant in the present case, we are satisfied that the appellant cannot claim to be a successor-in-interest of the firm so as to attract the provisions of s. 25FF of the Act.

facts.text: Three conditions of proviso to s. 25FF satisfied, but section itself not applicable.

anchor.surface_text: It is companymon ground that the three companyditions prescribed by clauses  a   b  and  c  of the proviso are satisfied in this case
Appeal by special leave from the award dated January 20, 1962, of the Industrial Tribunal No. 307 of 1961.

The short question of law which arises in this appeal by special leave relates to the construction of s. 25 FF of the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947  No. 14 of 1947   hereinafter called the Act  This question arises in this way.
